results.title: The Newstead Swimming Pool
results.creator_credit: Csilla Csongvay, Kim Montgomery and ACMI
results.brief_description: The Newstead Pool is an important hub of this Victorian town and a community hang-out that gets very lively in the summer. It is run by more than 50 volunteers and is a place for the community to gather and socialise, and has also been known for a sneaky skinny dip.

results.title: The Newspaper
results.brief_description: Describes the work of making up and printing an edition of various newspapers - a Hamburg paper, the second largest in Europe, to the regional newspapers with circulation of less than 10,000. The independence of the press is guaranteed in the Federal Republic, and the German people capitalise on this by reading more newspapers than other Europeans.

results.title: The News parade: Yanks recapture Guam! Paris liberated!
results.brief_description: Newsreel items: 1. Yanks recapture Guam, 3rd Marine Division landing with amphibious tanks going through sea-landing bay suffering a direct hit. 2. Paris liberated - aerial shots of Paris during liberation.

results.title: The News Parade: Yanks invade Marshall Islands
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine containing newsreel footage of American troopships sailing towards the Marshall Islands in 1944. Includes aerial shots of the US bombing of Japanese defenses; a navy attack; the gathering of empty shell cases; and scenes of the dead and wounded on both the American and Japanese sides.

results.title: The News parade: Tarawa
results.brief_description: Incorporates newsreel footage of World War II in three segments: footage of the fate of Japan being resolved by the United States, China and Great Britain; footage of Stalin, Churchill and Roosevelt; and footage depicting the capture of the Japanese at Tarawa by the United States Marines.

results.title: The News parade: San Francisco World's Fair
results.brief_description: Newsreel footage of the San Francisco World’s Fair held during 1939-1940 including: pioneers with oxcart, sailing ship and train; different parlours, parks, fountains, entertainment parlours, crowds. Staged spectacle on the settling of the West. Replica of an old mission, Japanese architecture, the Australia building, Chinese college and a replica of a Chinese walled city. Aerial shots of 400 acres of the fair grounds.

results.title: The News and the newsreel
results.brief_description: The proliferation of cinemas in the 1930’s, and the advent of the newsreel provided a window on the world for the ordinary working class person. This film presents two newsreels produced by two different companies as they appeared in the cinemas on 30th March, 1939, each giving a scant coverage of world political events, and social and sporting events on the home scene. Useful to compare the coverage of events in the two newsreels as well as comparing the newsreel with today’s television news coverage. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: The News
results.brief_description: Explains how news is gathered and disseminated in Germany. From an enormous amount of information culled from reporters, foreign correspondents, news agencies, radio satellites and many other sources, the editors shape the final story. This news story is spread within the country and overseas by radio, television, illuminated news signs, films, radio picture transmission newspapers and other media.

results.title: The Newfoundlanders: voices from the sea
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Magder Film Productions and Zale Magder
results.brief_description: This is a film about Newfoundland roots, culture and its present-day position in Canada as a significant maritime region community and as an important but little-known part of our history.

results.title: The Newcomers: inhabiting a new land
results.creator_credit: Nielsen-Ferns, Pat Ferns, Richard Nielsen and Eric Till
results.brief_description: Self-contained dramatisation concerning immigrants settling in a new land. John Symons, a Scottish radical, and his wife Margaret come to make a new life in Upper Canada. Symons faces the same challenges many settlers did during that period - poor farmland, back-breaking work for which he is ill-suited, isolation, a hard climate, and disease. Through perserverance and his own unconventional character, he is able to take advantage of the opportunities offered in the new world. He is a gifted entrepreneur. In his lifetime he becomes a wealthy businessman and landowner.
